import React from "react" import SelectedProduct from "./SelectedProduct" class Main extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { selected: "", stage: "1", } } // When the user clicks a product, it is added to state and passed to App.js, the stage is moved to stage: 1 setProduct = (product) => { this.setState({ selected: product }) this.setState({ stage: "1" }) this.props.setStage("1") this.props.setSelected(product) } render() { return (
this.setProduct("windows")}>

Windows

Double glazed windows add style, security and energy efficiency to your home.

Door Quote
this.setProduct("doors")}>

Doors

Double glazed windows add style, security and energy efficiency to your home.

Door Quote
) } } export default Main
